intro: Tetrazygia discolor var. acutidentata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tetrazygia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and wetlands. It is an herbaceous perennial that produces capsule fruits containing numerous small seeds. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
